Pre-Game Insights: India is the home favourite and expected to start as favourites.
Australia is known for knocking off World Cups and is expected to make the semi-finals at the least.
Spin is expected to be influential at Chepauk.
India lost to Australia at the same venue in March.
Team news: Shubman Gill is recovering from dengue and is a doubtful starter.
Hardik Pandya is back after being rested for the ODI series against Australia.
Glenn Maxwell has turned himself into a genuine allrounder in ODIs.
Marcus Stoinis is in a race against time to recover from a hamstring injury.
Pitch and conditions: A straw-coloured, black-soil pitch is likely to induce India to play three spinners.
Chepauk tends to offer a fair contest between bat and ball.
The weather is likely to be muggy, with a forecast maximum of 33 degrees Celsius.
The North-East monsoon could bring scattered showers in the evening.
Others: This is India's first match in a home World Cup.
The MA Chidambaram Stadium has hosted seven World Cup games.
India and Australia have met 12 times in ODIs since the end of the 2019 World Cup and won six games each.
